# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All"

source.f7adbed9:
# Get rid of strings in "Vol." column
df["Vol."] = df["Vol."].str.replace("B", "")
df["Vol."] = df["Vol."].str.replace("M", "")
df["Vol."] = df["Vol."].str.replace("-", "0")
df[:3]
source.5e95ded5:
# Change "Vol." column data types to integers
df["Vol."] = pd.to_numeric(df["Vol."])
df.info()
source.532622d1:
# Change 1.71 to 1710 in "Vol." column, row "0"
df["Vol."][:1] = df["Vol."][:1] *1000
df[:3]
source.ee278fff:
# Change date data type to datetime[ns]
df["Date"] = pd.to_datetime(df["Date"])
df.info()
source.f9b16bad:
import matplotlib
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.style as style

style.use("bmh")

df.plot(figsize = (18,8), x = "Date", y = "Price")
plt.xlabel("Date")
plt.ylabel("Price U$")
plt.title("ADA Price U$ : 20 Jan 2018 to  20 Feb 2021")
plt.legend("")

# **Cleaning the data**
* Get rid of strings in "Vol." column
* Change "Vol." column data types to integers
* Change 1.71 to 1710 in "Vol." column, row "0"
* Change date data type to datetime[ns]
